tasks.name: Implement PDCA Cycle for System Maintenance
tasks.description: Introduce Plan-Do-Check-Act cycle from 'PDCACyple'. Apply the Plan-Do-Check-Act cycle to establish and improve a maintenance system for ensuring operational quality and addressing system issues.Ask users to consider topics listed in 'things_to_consider'.

step_overview.procedure: This step focuses on how to ensure the system meets its intended quality during its operational lifetime and how to fix the system in case of disruption or other issues.

maintenance_considerations.context: General description of the task at hand.

Failure prevention/maintenance: Best practices for storing critical components
Impact of physical environment on equipment
System failures: Future design for efficient emergency repairs
Subsystem failures: Skills and tools for effective monitoring
Impact of operating environment on subsystems

PDCACycle.Objective: Establish the goals of the maintenance system, such as ensuring system reliability, minimizing downtime, and addressing both immediate and long-term maintenance needs.
Actions: Identify specific maintenance objectives (e.g., extending the lifecycle of equipment, improving system safety).
Define the necessary resources (e.g., tools, personnel, spare parts) and outline the maintenance schedule.
Assess risks (e.g., unexpected system failures, resource shortages) and identify opportunities (e.g., introducing predictive maintenance technologies) to enhance system reliability.
Carry out preventive and corrective maintenance as scheduled.
Ensure that maintenance staff are trained and have access to the required tools and spare parts.
Monitor system performance during and after maintenance to ensure optimal functioning.

PDCACycle.Objective: Monitor the effectiveness of the maintenance plan and compare results against established objectives.
Actions: Use key performance indicators (KPIs) such as Mean Time Between Failures (MTBF) and Mean Time to Repair (MTTR) to measure the success of the maintenance activities.
Compare current performance with historical data to identify trends.
Review whether the maintenance tasks are meeting the desired reliability and safety standards.

PDCACycle.Objective: Make improvements to the maintenance system based on performance data and feedback.
Actions: Adjust the maintenance schedule or tasks based on observed system weaknesses or evolving requirements.
Implement new technologies (e.g., predictive maintenance systems) if opportunities for improvement are identified.
Ensure continuous training and development for maintenance personnel to address any gaps in skill or knowledge.

instructions: Provide the action plan inside the PDCA cycle when it is asked.

evaluation: When students need feedback, provide reflective questions.
